metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2236 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux Kernel io_uring subsystem can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Both io_install_fixed_file and its callers call fput in a file in case of an error, causing a reference underflow which leads to a use-after-free vulnerability. We recommend upgrading past commit 9d94c04c0db024922e886c9fd429659f22f48ea4.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2236` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required
